item.title: Obtain The Source Code For Particular UEK Kernel Versions
item.description:
One of the nice aspects of Linux is that its source code is openly available. This also applies to Oracle Linux, which ships with its own Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel (UEK).

The UEK kernel sources are publicly available on GitHub and can be obtained via git. This short note provides a quick walkthrough on how to obtain and check out the source code for a particular version.

Step 1: Clone the UEK GitHub repository

If you are behind a proxy, you may need to configure your proxy settings before starting. Then change to a directory with a few GB of free space and clone the repository using git. This may take a while, depending on the speed of your connection.
